009package Ch13_Color_Images;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
016import imagingbook.core.jdoc.JavaDocHelp;
017import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
018
019import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * ImageJ plugin, continuously desaturates the current image directly in RGB
024 * color space (without conversion to HSV or HSB). The degree of desaturation is
025 * controlled by factor S in [0,1]. With S = 1, the image is unchanged, with S
026 * = 0 the resulting image is completely colorless (gray). See Sec. 13.2.2
027 * (Prog. 13.5) of [1] for details.
028 * </p>
029 * <p>
030 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
031 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
032 * </p>
033 * 
034 * @author WB
035 */
036public class Desaturate_RGB implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
037        
038        private static double S = 0.3; // color saturation factor
039
040        /**
041         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open.
042         */
043        public Desaturate_RGB() {
044                if (noCurrentImage()) {
045                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.Flower);
046                }
047        }
048
049        @Override
050        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
051                return DOES_RGB;
052        }
053        
054        @Override
055        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
056                
057                if (!runDialog()) {
058                        return;
059                }
060                
061                final int w = ip.getWidth();
062                final int h = ip.getHeight();
063                
064                //iterate over all pixels
065                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
066                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
067
068                                // get int-packed color pixel
069                                int c = ip.get(u, v);
070
071                                // disassemble RGB components from int color pixel
072                                int r = (c & 0xff0000) >> 16;
073                                int g = (c & 0x00ff00) >> 8;
074                                int b = (c & 0x0000ff);
075
076                                //compute equivalent gray value (luma, ITU BR.601 weights)
077                                double y = 0.299 * r + 0.587 * g + 0.114 * b;
078
079                                // linearly interpolate $(yyy) --> (rgb)
080                                r = clamp(y + S * (r - y));
081                                g = clamp(y + S * (g - y));
082                                b = clamp(y + S * (b - y));
083
084                                // reassemble color pixel to int
085                                c = ((r & 0xff) << 16) | ((g & 0xff) << 8) | b & 0xff; 
086                                ip.set(u, v, c);
087                        }
088                }
089        }
090        
091        private int clamp(double val) {
092                int z = (int) Math.round(val);
093                if (z < 0) return 0;
094                if (z > 255) return 255;
095                return z;
096        }
097        
098        private boolean runDialog() {
099                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
100                gd.addHelp(getJavaDocUrl());
101                gd.addMessage("Saturates or desaturates the current image.");
102                gd.addNumericField("Saturation factor (S = 0..1)", S, 2);
103                
104                gd.showDialog();
105                if (gd.wasCanceled())
106                        return false;
107                
108                S = gd.getNextNumber();
109                if (S < 0) S = 0;
110                if (S > 1) S = 1;
111                return true;
112        }
113
114}
